channel.title: Comments on: Case Insensitive Dir.glob In Ruby: Really? It Has To Be That Cryptic?

item.title: By: M@
item.dc:creator: M@
item.description:
I know this is quite late, but you could do this:
Dir["#{ folder }**/*.{hl,Hl,HL,hL}7""].each |file| LabResort.import file end
Sort of a middle ground, legibility-wise.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Mister
item.dc:creator: Mister
item.description:
Hi. I would do this:
irb(main):052:0> Dir.entries(".") => [".", "..", "test3.tXt", "test2.TXT", "test4.text", "test1.txt"] irb(main):053:0> txt = Dir.glob("*").grep(/txt$/i) => ["test3.tXt", "test2.TXT", "test1.txt"]
item.content:encoded:
Hi. I would do this:

irb(main):052:0> Dir.entries(“.”)
=> [".", "..", "test3.tXt", "test2.TXT", "test4.text", "test1.txt"]
irb(main):053:0> txt = Dir.glob(“*”).grep(/txt$/i)
=> ["test3.tXt", "test2.TXT", "test1.txt"]
